name: BCUninstaller
description: BCUninstaller (Bulk Crap Uninstaller) is a free and open-source uninstaller for Windows that can also be used on Linux through Wine or similar compatibility layers.

details.features: Batch uninstall, leftover scanner, portable, forced uninstall, install tracking.
details.whenToUse: Cleaning many programs at once, removing stubborn apps, or auditing installs.
details.whenNotToUse: Single app removal via system settings is enough.
details.tips: Run leftover scan after uninstalling to remove registry/leftover files.

name: WizTree
description: WizTree is a free, open-source disk space analyzer for Windows that reads the Master File Table (MFT) directly for extremely fast scans. It shows folder and file sizes in a treemap view so you can quickly identify what is consuming disk space.

details.features: Fast disk scan (uses MFT), size by folder/file, treemap view.
details.whenToUse: Finding what uses disk space quickly on large drives.
details.whenNotToUse: For everyday file browsing use a normal file manager.
details.tips: Run as admin for full drive access; sort by size to find big folders first.

name: ProtonVPN
description: ProtonVPN is a free and open-source virtual private network (VPN) service from the makers of Proton Mail. It offers a no-logs policy, kill switch, DNS leak protection, and open-source clients for Linux and other platforms.

details.features: No-logs policy, kill switch, DNS leak protection, open-source clients.
details.whenToUse: Public Wi‑Fi, privacy, or region-restricted content.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need maximum throughput for large downloads.
details.tips: Use split tunneling to only route specific apps through the VPN.

name: ClamAV
description: ClamAV is a free, open-source, cross-platform antimalware engine for detecting viruses, trojans, and other malware. Originally designed for Unix and mail gateways; it runs on Linux, macOS, and Windows and is used for on-demand and on-access scanning.

details.features: On-demand and on-access scanning, signature updates, email scanning.
details.whenToUse: Server/mail scanning, occasional file checks, compliance scans.
details.whenNotToUse: As sole real-time AV on a high-risk Windows desktop.
details.tips: Update signatures (freshclam) before big scans; use with a scheduler for automation.

name: Topgrade
description: Topgrade detects all package managers, tools, and configs on your system and updates everything with a single command: topgrade.

details.features: Detects apt, brew, pip, cargo, npm, etc.; single command; customizable.
details.whenToUse: After a break or when you want one command to update everything.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need to update only one stack (e.g. only apt).
details.tips: Review config in ~/.config/topgrade.toml to skip or add tools.

name: Ventoy
description: Ventoy creates bootable USB drives that hold multiple ISO/WIM/IMG/VHD(x)/EFI files. Copy images as files and pick one from the boot menu.

details.features: Multi-ISO on one stick, no re-flash per OS, UEFI/Legacy, persistence support.
details.whenToUse: Multi-boot USBs, sysadmin toolkit, or trying several Linux distros.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need a single, locked-down install stick for one OS.
details.tips: Keep Ventoy updated; use a fast USB 3 drive for better boot speed.

name: Playwright
description: Playwright is a free, open-source library for automating Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit. It is used for end-to-end testing, browser automation, and reliable web scraping with auto-wait and network control.

details.features: Cross-browser (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit), auto-wait, network control.
details.whenToUse: E2E tests, browser automation, or reliable scraping.
details.whenNotToUse: Quick one-off scripts where curl or simple HTTP is enough.
details.tips: Use codegen to record actions and generate scripts; run in headed mode to debug.

name: Flameshot
description: Powerful yet simple screenshot tool. Recently received its first major update in 3 years (v13).

details.features: Region/custom selection, annotations, blur, upload, shortcuts.
details.whenToUse: Docs, bug reports, or any screenshot that needs markup.
details.whenNotToUse: Full-screen captures only with no edits.
details.tips: Assign a global shortcut (e.g. Print Screen) for quick capture.

links.label: Flameshot Screenshot App Gets First Major Update in 3 Years

latestNews.title: Flameshot Screenshot App Gets First Major Update in 3 Years

name: OBS Studio
description: OBS Studio is a free, open-source application for video recording and live streaming. It supports multiple sources (displays, windows, cameras, browser overlays), real-time encoding, and streaming to platforms like Twitch, YouTube, and custom RTMP servers.

details.features: Multiple sources, scenes, filters, streaming to Twitch/YouTube/RTMP, recording to file, low latency.
details.whenToUse: Live streaming, screen recording, game capture, or multi-source video production.
details.whenNotToUse: Simple one-window screen capture; use OS or lighter tools instead.
details.tips: Use Scene Collections to switch between different stream setups; enable hardware encoding (NVENC/AMF) for lower CPU load.

name: VLC
description: Free and open-source portable cross-platform media player and streaming media server.

details.features: Wide format support, streaming, conversions, subtitles, filters.
details.whenToUse: Any local video/audio file or simple streaming.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need heavy editing or professional NLE features.
details.tips: Use Tools → Codec Information to debug playback issues.

name: Discord
description: Discord is a voice, video, and text communication platform popular with gamers and communities. It offers servers, channels, screen sharing, bots, and optional Nitro subscriptions. Available on desktop, mobile, and web.

details.features: Voice/video calls, text channels, screen share, bots, server roles, integrations.
details.whenToUse: Community chat, gaming voice, team coordination, or streaming with viewers.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need end-to-end encryption or fully open protocols.
details.tips: Use server folders and notification settings to manage multiple communities without overload.

name: Telegram
description: Telegram is a cloud-based instant messaging app with a focus on speed and optional end-to-end encryption (Secret Chats). It supports channels, bots, large file sharing, and syncs across mobile and desktop. API and clients are open.

details.features: Cloud sync, secret chats (E2EE), channels, bots, large files, multi-device.
details.whenToUse: Fast messaging, channels, or groups with optional privacy features.
details.whenNotToUse: When you require E2EE by default for all chats (use Signal-style apps).
details.tips: Enable Secret Chats for sensitive conversations; use folders to organize channels and groups.

name: OnlyOffice
description: OnlyOffice is an open-source office suite with document, spreadsheet, and presentation editors. It is compatible with Microsoft Office formats and recently added an 'AI Agent' for productivity. Available for desktop and self-hosted collaboration.

details.features: Writer, Calc, Presentation, OOXML compatibility, AI Agent, collaboration.
details.whenToUse: Editing Office documents without Microsoft 365 or with self-hosted collaboration.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need advanced Excel macros or 100% MSO compatibility.
details.tips: Use the AI Agent for drafting and summaries; connect to a server for real-time co-editing.

links.label: ONLYOFFICE Adds an "AI Agent" to Help You Work "Effortlessly"

latestNews.title: ONLYOFFICE Adds an "AI Agent" to Help You Work "Effortlessly"

name: VS Code
description: Visual Studio Code is a free, lightweight source-code editor by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, and macOS. It supports extensions, built-in Git, debugging, and a rich ecosystem for almost any language or framework.

details.features: Extensions, built-in terminal, Git, debug, multi-cursor, themes.
details.whenToUse: General coding, quick edits, or extension-rich workflows.
details.whenNotToUse: Heavy IDE features (e.g. full IntelliJ-style refactors).
details.tips: Use workspace settings and profiles for different project types.

name: Steam
description: Steam is Valve's digital distribution platform for PC games. It offers a store, library, automatic updates, cloud saves, achievements, and Steam Deck support. Many titles run on Linux via Proton.

details.features: Game store, library, cloud saves, achievements, Proton (Linux gaming), Steam Deck.
details.whenToUse: Buying and playing PC games, especially with Linux or Steam Deck.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only play from other stores (Epic, GOG) or console.
details.tips: Enable Steam Play (Proton) in Settings for broader Linux game compatibility.

name: Brave
description: Brave is a free, open-source browser based on Chromium with built-in privacy and ad blocking. It blocks trackers and ads by default, offers optional Brave Rewards (BAT), and supports Tor for private tabs.

details.features: Built-in ad/tracker blocking, Brave Shields, optional BAT rewards, Tor private tabs.
details.whenToUse: Privacy-focused browsing without extra extensions; Chromium compatibility.
details.whenNotToUse: When you rely on specific Chrome extensions that conflict with Brave.
details.tips: Adjust Shields per-site if a page breaks; use Private Window with Tor for maximum anonymity.

name: Insomnia
description: Insomnia is an open-source API client and design platform for REST, GraphQL, and gRPC. It supports environments, code generation, and organizing requests into workspaces for development and testing.

details.features: REST/GraphQL/gRPC, environments, code gen, request history, plugins.
details.whenToUse: API development, testing endpoints, or documenting APIs.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only need quick one-off curl-style requests.
details.tips: Use environments for dev/staging/prod and environment variables for tokens and URLs.

name: Firefox
description: Firefox is a free, open-source web browser by the Mozilla Foundation. It emphasizes privacy, customizability, and a non-Chromium engine. Supports extensions, containers, and strong privacy controls.

details.features: Privacy controls, extensions, multi-account containers, sync, Pocket.
details.whenToUse: Privacy-first browsing, avoiding Chromium monoculture, or extension-rich workflows.
details.whenNotToUse: When a site or workflow requires Chrome-specific APIs.
details.tips: Use Multi-Account Containers to isolate logins (e.g. work vs personal).

name: Inkscape
description: Inkscape is a free, open-source vector graphics editor. It uses SVG natively and supports paths, text, gradients, clones, and extensions. Suitable for logos, illustrations, and print-ready artwork.

details.features: SVG-native, paths, text, gradients, extensions, trace bitmap, PDF export.
details.whenToUse: Logos, icons, illustrations, or any scalable vector artwork.
details.whenNotToUse: Raster image editing or heavy bitmap work; use GIMP instead.
details.tips: Use layers and object grouping; export PNG at target resolution for web or print.

name: KDE Plasma
description: KDE Plasma is a powerful, flexible desktop environment for Linux with a modern look and extensive customization. It includes a panel, widgets, activities, and strong accessibility. Version 6.4 added new features and polish.

details.features: Panel, widgets, activities, KWin, system settings, Qt-based apps.
details.whenToUse: A full-featured, customizable Linux desktop with a polished UI.
details.whenNotToUse: When you prefer a minimal or non-Qt desktop (e.g. GNOME, Xfce).
details.tips: Explore System Settings for themes and shortcuts; use Activities for separate workspaces.

links.label: KDE Plasma 6.4 Released, This is What's New

latestNews.title: KDE Plasma 6.4 Released, This is What's New

name: Hyprland
description: Hyprland is a dynamic tiling Wayland compositor with a focus on eye candy, animations, and keyboard-driven workflow. It supports gaps, rounded corners, and a config-driven setup for power users.

details.features: Dynamic tiling, gaps, rounded corners, animations, keybinds, hyprlang config.
details.whenToUse: Wayland-based tiling setup with a polished, customizable desktop.
details.whenNotToUse: When you prefer X11 or a traditional floating desktop.
details.tips: Configure in ~/.config/hypr/hyprland.conf; use the wiki for keybinds and plugins.

name: Syncthing
description: Syncthing is a continuous, decentralized file synchronization program. It syncs folders between your own devices over the local network or the internet without a central server. Version 2.0 brought a major database overhaul for better performance.

details.features: P2P sync, no central server, versioning, conflict handling, encryption, Web UI.
details.whenToUse: Syncing files across your own devices (PC, laptop, NAS) privately.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need cloud backup or shared team folders with access control.
details.tips: Use folder ignore patterns to skip large or temporary files; enable versioning for important folders.

links.label: Syncthing 2.0 Launches With Major Database Overhaul

latestNews.title: Syncthing 2.0 Launches With Major Database Overhaul

name: Gradia
description: Gradia is a modern, slick screenshot and annotation tool for Linux. It offers a clean interface for capturing regions or windows and adding arrows, text, and shapes for documentation or bug reports.

details.features: Region/window capture, annotations, arrows, text, shapes, clean UI.
details.whenToUse: Documentation, bug reports, or quick annotated screenshots on Linux.
details.whenNotToUse: Heavy screen recording or multi-page markup; use OBS or dedicated tools.
details.tips: Assign a global shortcut for quick capture and annotation workflow.

links.label: Gradia is a Slick New Screenshot Annotation Tool for Linux

name: Kapitano
description: Scans for Windows malware on Linux using ClamAV. The developer has recently abandoned the project.

links.label: Kapitano (Linux Antivirus Scanner) Developer Abandons Ship

latestNews.title: Kapitano (Linux Antivirus Scanner) Developer Abandons Ship

name: Dozzle
description: Dozzle is a real-time Docker log viewer that runs in the browser. It lets you stream and search container logs without using the CLI. Version 8.13 added improvements and fixes.

details.features: Real-time log streaming, search, multiple containers, lightweight web UI.
details.whenToUse: Monitoring Docker container logs without opening a terminal.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need log aggregation across hosts or long-term storage.
details.tips: Run as a container and mount the Docker socket for full container list access.

links.label: Dozzle 8.13 Real‑Time Docker Log Viewer Released

name: RetroArch
description: RetroArch is a frontend for emulators, game engines, and media players. It unifies cores (libretro) for many classic systems (NES, SNES, Genesis, etc.) with a single interface, shaders, and netplay. One of the best ways to play classic games on Linux.

details.features: Libretro cores, shaders, netplay, save states, rewind, unified config.
details.whenToUse: Playing retro games from multiple systems with one app.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only need a single system and prefer a simpler standalone emulator.
details.tips: Download cores from the built-in Core Downloader; use shaders for CRT-style display.

links.label: RetroArch is The Best Way to Play Classic Games on Linux

name: Packet
description: Packet is a Linux application for fast file transfers between your PC and Android device over the local network. It uses a simple connection flow and avoids cloud services for direct device-to-device transfer.

details.features: LAN transfer, no cloud, simple pairing, fast transfer.
details.whenToUse: Moving files between Linux and Android on the same network quickly.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need remote access or cross-platform beyond Linux/Android.
details.tips: Ensure both devices are on the same Wi-Fi; use the Android app to connect to the Linux daemon.

links.label: Packet is the Linux App You Didn't Know You Needed for Fast Android File Transfers

name: Rescuezilla
description: Rescuezilla is a 'Swiss Army Knife' live Linux toolkit for system recovery, disk imaging, and cloning. It is based on Ubuntu and supports Clonezilla-style imaging, backup, and restore. Version 2.6.1 uses an Ubuntu 25.04 base.

details.features: Disk image, clone, backup, restore, live boot, GUI, Clonezilla-compatible.
details.whenToUse: Full disk backup, system clone, or recovery after failure.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only need file-level backup (use rsync or similar).
details.tips: Boot from USB; store images on an external drive; verify images after creation.

name: Fwupd
description: Fwupd is a daemon that provides firmware updates on Linux for supported hardware (BIOS/UEFI, drives, peripherals). It integrates with GNOME Software and the command line. Version 2.0.13 improved startup time and memory use.

details.features: BIOS/UEFI and device firmware updates, LVFS, CLI and GUI.
details.whenToUse: Updating firmware on Linux for supported laptops and peripherals.
details.whenNotToUse: When your hardware is not on the LVFS compatibility list.
details.tips: Check fwupdmgr get-devices; ensure battery is charged before firmware updates.

links.label: Fwupd 2.0.13 Released with Faster Startup and Lower Memory Use

latestNews.title: Fwupd 2.0.13 Released with Faster Startup and Lower Memory Use

name: IPFire
description: IPFire is a hardened Linux distribution designed as a router and firewall. It offers stateful packet filtering, VPN (including WireGuard), proxy, and intrusion detection. Core Update 196 improved WireGuard and the console graphics stack.

details.features: Firewall, VPN (WireGuard, OpenVPN), proxy, IDS, green/orange/blue zones.
details.whenToUse: Home or small-office firewall, VPN gateway, or network segmentation.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need a general-purpose server OS (use a normal distro).
details.tips: Configure zones (e.g. DMZ) and keep add-ons updated for security.

links.label: IPFire 2.29 Core Update 196 Improves WireGuard Support, Console Graphics Stack

latestNews.title: IPFire 2.29 Core Update 196 Improves WireGuard Support, Console Graphics Stack

name: Disk Usage Analyser
description: Disk Usage Analyser (e.g. Baobab on GNOME) is a simple yet powerful tool that visualizes disk usage in a treemap or list. It helps you see which folders and files consume the most space on Linux.

details.features: Treemap and list view, scan any directory, quick summary.
details.whenToUse: Finding what is using disk space on your system.
details.whenNotToUse: For very large drives where MFT-based tools (e.g. WizTree) are faster on Windows.
details.tips: Scan your home directory and common locations like .cache and snap to find big consumers.

name: Barrier
description: Barrier is a free, open-source application that lets you share one mouse and keyboard across multiple computers on your local network. It is a software KVM alternative without extra hardware.

details.features: Mouse/keyboard sharing, multi-machine, configurable screen layout, SSL.
details.whenToUse: Using several PCs on one desk with a single keyboard and mouse.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need to share only the screen (use RDP/VNC) or require commercial support.
details.tips: Configure the screen positions to match your physical monitor layout for smooth cursor movement.

name: SnapSafe
description: SnapSafe is a simple, privacy-focused camera app for Android. It avoids unnecessary permissions and cloud uploads so you can take photos and videos without sharing data with third parties.

details.features: Minimal permissions, no cloud, simple capture, privacy-first.
details.whenToUse: When you want a camera app that does not send data to the cloud.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need advanced editing or built-in cloud backup.
details.tips: Grant only storage permission if you want to save to device only.

name: Aurora Store
description: Aurora Store is an unofficial, open-source client for the Google Play Store. It lets you browse and install apps without a Google account and offers anonymous or session-based access.

details.features: Play Store access without account, anonymous installs, updates, FOSS.
details.whenToUse: Installing Play apps without a Google account or with minimal tracking.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need paid apps or in-app purchases tied to a Google account.
details.tips: Use anonymous session for one-off installs; keep the app updated for compatibility.

name: Auxio
description: Auxio is a simple, powerful, open-source music player for Android. It focuses on local playback with a clean interface, no ads, and support for common audio formats and playlists.

details.features: Local playback, playlists, album art, no ads, lightweight.
details.whenToUse: Listening to local music files on Android without bloat.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need streaming or cloud library sync.
details.tips: Point the app to your music folder; use playlists for quick access.

name: App Lock
description: App Lock is a simple, privacy-focused app that lets you lock selected apps with a PIN, pattern, or biometrics so others cannot open them without your permission.

details.features: Per-app lock, PIN/pattern/biometric, minimal permissions.
details.whenToUse: Preventing others from opening sensitive apps (banking, messages).
details.whenNotToUse: When you need full device encryption only (use system lock).
details.tips: Lock messaging and finance apps; use a strong pattern or PIN.

name: Limpazap
description: Limpazap is a utility that cleans WhatsApp media files from your device. It helps you free space by removing old photos, videos, and voice notes stored by WhatsApp while keeping your chats intact.

details.features: Scan WhatsApp media, selective delete, free space, chats preserved.
details.whenToUse: When WhatsApp is using too much storage and you want to remove media only.
details.whenNotToUse: When you want to delete entire chats or backup to cloud.
details.tips: Review the list before deleting; backup important media elsewhere first.

name: Tracker Controller
description: Tracker Controller is an open-source app that lets you see and control which trackers and permissions other apps use. It helps you block or limit tracking and unnecessary permissions on Android.

details.features: View trackers per app, block/allow, permission control, FOSS.
details.whenToUse: Reducing tracking and tightening app permissions on Android.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need system-wide VPN-based blocking (use NetGuard or similar).
details.tips: Check tracker list after installing new apps; some blocking may affect app functionality.

name: Tuta
description: Tuta (formerly Tutanota) is a secure, open-source email service and client with built-in end-to-end encryption. It offers encrypted mail, calendar, and contacts on Android and other platforms.

details.features: E2EE email, calendar, contacts, secure password recovery, no ads.
details.whenToUse: When you want encrypted email and calendar without relying on big providers.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need full IMAP/SMTP with third-party clients.
details.tips: Use the built-in calendar and contacts for full encrypted sync.

name: Simple
description: Simple is an open-source mobile app to track training programs and workouts. It helps you log exercises, sets, and progress without cloud lock-in or unnecessary permissions.

details.features: Workout logging, exercises, sets/reps, progress, no account required.
details.whenToUse: Tracking gym or home workouts with minimal fuss.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need wearables sync or social features.
details.tips: Create routines for repeated workouts; export data if you switch apps.

name: Tasks
description: Tasks is a simple, open-source todo list app that syncs with CalDAV (e.g. Nextcloud). It supports lists, due dates, and reminders while keeping your data on your own server if you use CalDAV.

details.features: Todo lists, due dates, reminders, CalDAV sync, widgets.
details.whenToUse: Managing tasks with optional self-hosted sync via CalDAV.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need complex project management or team features.
details.tips: Connect to a CalDAV server (Nextcloud, Radicale) for sync across devices.

name: Grit
description: Grit is an open-source Mastodon client for Android. It provides a native interface for reading the timeline, posting, and interacting with the fediverse (Mastodon and compatible instances).

details.features: Timeline, post, boost, reply, notifications, multi-account.
details.whenToUse: Using Mastodon or the fediverse on Android with a FOSS client.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need Twitter/X or other proprietary networks.
details.tips: Add your Mastodon instance; use multiple accounts for different servers.

name: OpenFood Facts
description: OpenFood Facts is a free, open-source database and app. Scan barcodes to see ingredients, nutrition, and environmental impact so you can make informed food choices. Community-driven and available on multiple platforms.

details.features: Barcode scan, nutrition, ingredients, Nutri-Score, community data.
details.whenToUse: Checking what is in packaged food or comparing products.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need diet planning or medical advice (use with professional guidance).
details.tips: Contribute by adding or editing products to improve the database.

name: InviZible Pro
description: InviZible Pro is an open-source app that combines Tor, DNS over HTTPS, and a firewall to improve online privacy and security on Android. It routes traffic through Tor and blocks unwanted connections.

details.features: Tor integration, DNS over HTTPS, firewall, privacy controls.
details.whenToUse: Strong anonymity (Tor) or encrypted DNS on Android.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need maximum speed; Tor can be slower.
details.tips: Use Orbot for full Tor; configure DNS and firewall per your needs.

name: NetGuard
description: NetGuard is an open-source firewall for Android that blocks internet access per application without root. You can allow or block Wi-Fi and/or mobile data per app to reduce tracking and data usage.

details.features: Per-app block (Wi-Fi/mobile), no root, traffic log, optional VPN mode.
details.whenToUse: Blocking specific apps from the internet or reducing background data.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need system-wide Tor or complex routing (use Orbot/InviZible).
details.tips: Enable 'Block when roaming' for apps you do not want using mobile data abroad.

name: F-Droid
description: F-Droid is an installable catalogue of free and open-source applications for Android. It provides a repository and client so you can discover and install FOSS apps without the Google Play Store.

details.features: FOSS app repository, no account, optional anti-feature labels, updates.
details.whenToUse: Finding and installing open-source Android apps without Google.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need proprietary or Play-only apps (use Aurora Store for those).
details.tips: Enable 'Unstable' or third-party repos for more apps; check anti-features in app listings.

name: Money Manager Ex
description: Money Manager Ex is a free, open-source personal finance manager. It helps you track accounts, income, expenses, and budgets. Data is stored locally and can be synced across Android, Windows, and other platforms.

details.features: Accounts, transactions, budgets, reports, multi-currency, local/sync.
details.whenToUse: Tracking personal or family finances without cloud lock-in.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need bank sync or investment tracking with live data.
details.tips: Back up the database regularly; use categories and payees for consistent reporting.

name: NewPipe
description: NewPipe is a lightweight, open-source YouTube front-end for Android. It does not use the official API or Google services, supports background playback and picture-in-picture, and can download audio or video.

details.features: No Google API, background/PiP, download audio/video, subscriptions, no ads.
details.whenToUse: Watching YouTube without Google account or with download/background support.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need official YouTube features like live chat or memberships.
details.tips: Export subscriptions from YouTube and import into NewPipe; use SponsorBlock for skip segments.

name: Anime Slayer
description: Anime Slayer is an application for watching and downloading anime on Android. It aggregates streams and allows offline viewing. Popular among anime fans for a wide catalog and download support.

details.features: Stream anime, download for offline, catalog, multiple sources.
details.whenToUse: Watching and downloading anime on Android.
details.whenNotToUse: When you prefer official licensors (Crunchyroll, etc.) for supported regions.
details.tips: Check regional availability; use downloads for offline viewing.

name: OnStream
description: OnStream is a streaming application for movies and TV shows on Android. It offers a catalog of titles with streaming and optional download for offline viewing. Popular for entertainment on the go.

details.features: Movie and TV catalog, streaming, download, search.
details.whenToUse: Watching movies and TV shows on Android.
details.whenNotToUse: When you prefer only licensed services (Netflix, etc.).
details.tips: Use on a trusted network; check local laws regarding streaming content.

name: Streamio
description: Streamio is a streaming platform for movies and series on Android. It provides a catalog of content for streaming and download. Used by many for entertainment and offline viewing.

details.features: Movies and series catalog, streaming, download, search.
details.whenToUse: Streaming or downloading movies and series on Android.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only use official subscription services.
details.tips: Use on a secure connection; be aware of regional and legal considerations.

name: Boycott X
description: Boycott X is an app that helps you identify products and brands so you can make informed purchasing decisions based on ethics, politics, or social awareness. Scan barcodes or search to see brand information.

details.features: Barcode scan, brand info, boycott lists, community-driven.
details.whenToUse: Checking whether a product aligns with your values before buying.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only need nutrition or ingredient info (use OpenFood Facts).
details.tips: Contribute by adding or updating brand data to help others.

name: Salatuk
description: Salatuk is an app that provides accurate prayer times and Qibla direction for Muslims. It uses your location to calculate prayer times and shows the direction to Mecca for salah. Often includes adhan and optional widgets.

details.features: Prayer times, Qibla compass, location-based, adhan, widgets.
details.whenToUse: Finding prayer times and Qibla direction on the go.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need only a simple clock or timezone tool.
details.tips: Allow location for accurate times; set notification for adhan if desired.

name: BitWarden
description: Free and open-source password management service.

details.features: Vault, sync, 2FA, sharing, browser extensions, CLI.
details.whenToUse: Any device; need sync and open-source trust.
details.whenNotToUse: When you only need a single-device, offline store.
details.tips: Use Bitwarden Send for one-time secure sharing.

name: Fing
description: Fing is a set of network tools and a Wi-Fi scanner for discovering devices on your network, checking connectivity, and running basic diagnostics. Available on Android and other platforms.

details.features: Device discovery, port scan, ping, DNS lookup, network info.
details.whenToUse: Seeing what devices are on your Wi-Fi or troubleshooting connectivity.
details.whenNotToUse: When you need deep packet inspection or enterprise monitoring.
details.tips: Use on your home network to audit connected devices and open ports.

name: Slack
